alert.note: Alert for Butler; Warren (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 2:14AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Butler, southeastern Grayson, northwestern Warren and northwestern Edmonson Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 113 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles east of Morgantown to 8 miles northwest of Crestmoor. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph and dime size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Grayson, northwestern Warren, northwestern Edmonson and east central Butler Counties, including the following locations... Windyville, Roundhill, Black Gold, Broadway, Rockland, Peonia, Sadler, Nash, Sunfish and Huff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
